chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay mandatory DNA surcharge, and all other applicable costs, surcharges and assessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to a civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision, but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 156 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain fulltime employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.

Sex offender assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended supervision are as to each count.

Provide DNA sample.
Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with  DOC.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not possess any firearms and body armor; and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael A Willis in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Michael A Willis in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 27 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 156 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 17 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the  Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

As to each count:  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Mental health assessment  and comply with recommended treatment.
*Sex offender assessment ad comply with recommended treatment
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with DNW, and co-actors: Kendall Simmons and Kevone Hughes
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges

As to each count: Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharges AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC.  

Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he/she may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
- Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
- Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad

On motion of defense, Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 7-20-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 10.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS OF AMENDED INFORMATION:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Michael A Willis in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Michael A Willis in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charges amended to: 
Count 1: Armed Robbery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(a) and (2), 939.05, 939.50(3)(c), a Class C Felony;
Count 2: False Imprisonment, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.30, 939.05, 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.  Calendar call scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert Lee Taylor in court, defendant Michael A Willis not in court, in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial/projected guilty plea in Branch 10.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Willis in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Michael A Willis in custody.  Ron Dague for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DNW

Defendant Michael A Willis in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Michael A Willis in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
